org.puredata.android.io

Class AudioWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.puredata.android.io.AudioWrapper

  • public abstract class AudioWrapper
extends Object
    AudioWrapper wraps AudioTrack and AudioRecord objects and manages the main audio rendering thread. It hides the complexity of working with raw PCM audio; client code only needs to implement a JACK-style audio processing callback (jackaudio.org).
    Author:
    Peter Brinkmann (peter.brinkmann@gmail.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void avoidClickHack(Context context) 
      boolean isRunning() 
      protected abstract int process(short[] inBuffer, short[] outBuffer)
      Main audio rendering callback, reads input samples and writes output samples; inspired by the process callback of JACK Channels are striped across buffers, i.e., if there are two output channels, then outBuffer[0] will be the first sample for the left channel, outBuffer[1] will be the first sample for the right channel, outBuffer[2] will be the second sample for the left channel, etc.
      void release()
      Release resources held by AudioTrack and AudioRecord objects; stops the audio thread if it is still running
      void start(Context context)
      Start the audio rendering thread as well as AudioTrack and AudioRecord objects
      void stop()
      Stop the audio thread as well as AudioTrack and AudioRecord objects

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioWrapper

        public AudioWrapper(int sampleRate,
            int inChannels,
            int outChannels,
            int bufferSizePerChannel)
             throws IOException
        Constructor; initializes AudioTrack and AudioRecord objects
        Parameters:
        sampleRate -
        inChannels - number of input channels
        outChannels - number of output channels
        bufferSizePerChannel - number of samples per buffer per channel
        Throws:
        IOException - if the audio parameters are not supported by the device

    • Method Detail

      • process

        protected abstract int process(short[] inBuffer,
          short[] outBuffer)
        Main audio rendering callback, reads input samples and writes output samples; inspired by the process callback of JACK Channels are striped across buffers, i.e., if there are two output channels, then outBuffer[0] will be the first sample for the left channel, outBuffer[1] will be the first sample for the right channel, outBuffer[2] will be the second sample for the left channel, etc.
        Parameters:
        inBuffer - array of input samples to be processed, e.g., from the microphone
        outBuffer - array of output samples, e.g., to be sent to the speakers
        Returns:

      • start

        public void start(Context context)
        Start the audio rendering thread as well as AudioTrack and AudioRecord objects
        Parameters:
        context -

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the audio thread as well as AudioTrack and AudioRecord objects

      • release

        public void release()
        Release resources held by AudioTrack and AudioRecord objects; stops the audio thread if it is still running

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns:
        true if and only if the audio thread is currently running

        private void avoidClickHack(Context context)
